Name: Requiring the dept of correction to report on security indicators in city jails, and to repeal section 9-130 of such code, jail data reporting on adolescents.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to report on security indicators in city jails, and to repeal section 9-130 of such code, in relation to jail data reporting on adolescents
BodyName: Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Summary: The Department of Correction is currently required to report on a broad array of violence statistics for adolescent inmates. This bill repeals that law and replaces it with an expanded reporting requirement that includes adult inmates. The Department must report on 7 violence-related statistics monthly, an additional 16 statistics quarterly, and an additional 4 statistics yearly. This report will also separate reporting for inmates aged 16-17, 18-21, and 22 years old or older.

\v ..Title\par
\v0 A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to report on security indicators in city jails, and to repeal section 9-130 of such code, in relation to jail data reporting on adolescents\par
\v ..Body\fs27\par
\v0  \par
\ul\fs24 Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult0\fs24       Section 1. Section 9-130 of the administrative code of the city of New York is REPEALED and a new section 9-130 is added to read as follows:\fs27\par
\ul\fs24\'a7 9-130  Jail data reporting.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 a. Definitions. For purposes of this section, the following terms have the following meanings:\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Adolescent. The term \ldblquote adolescent\rdblquote  means an inmate 16 or 17 years of age.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Adult. The term \ldblquote adult\rdblquote  means an inmate 22 years of age or older.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Assault. The term \ldblquote assault\rdblquote  means any action taken with intent to cause physical injury to another person.\par
Department. The term \ldblquote department\rdblquote  means the New York city department of correction.\par
Hospital. The term \ldblquote hospital\rdblquote  includes any hospital setting, whether a hospital outside of the department\rquote s jurisdiction or a correction unit operated by the department within a hospital.\ulnone\par
\ul Serious injury.  The term \ldblquote serious injury\rdblquote  means a physical injury that (i) creates a substantial risk of death or disfigurement; (ii) is a loss or impairment of a bodily organ; (iii) is a fracture or break to a bone other than fingers and toes; or (iv) is an injury defined as serious by a physician.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Sexual abuse. The term \ldblquote sexual abuse\rdblquote  has the same meaning as set forth in section 115.6 of title 28 of the code of federal regulations, or successor regulation, promulgated pursuant to the federal prison rape elimination act of 2003. \ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Staff.  The term \ldblquote staff\rdblquote  means anyone other than an inmate who works at a facility operated by the department.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Young adult.  The term \ldblquote young adult\rdblquote  means an inmate 18 to 21 years of age.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Use of force A.  The term \ldblquote use of force A\rdblquote  means a use of force by staff on an inmate resulting in an injury that requires medical treatment beyond the prescription of over-the-counter analgesics or the administration of minor first aid, including those uses of force resulting in one or more of the following: (i) multiple abrasions and/or contusions; (ii) chipped or cracked tooth; (iii) loss of tooth; (iv) laceration; (v) puncture; (vi) fracture; (vii) loss of consciousness, including a concussion; (viii) suture; (ix) internal injuries, including but not limited to ruptured spleen or perforated eardrum; or (x) admission to a hospital.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Use of force B. The term \ldblquote use of force B\rdblquote  means a use of force by staff on an inmate which does not require hospitalization or medical treatment beyond the prescription of over-the-counter analgesics or the administration of minor first aid, including the following: (i) a use of force resulting in a superficial bruise, scrape, scratch, or minor swelling; and (ii) the forcible use of mechanical restraints in a confrontational situation that results in no or minor injury.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Use of force C.  The term \ldblquote use of force C\rdblquote  means a use of force by staff on an inmate resulting in no injury to staff or inmate, including an incident where the use of oleoresin capsicum spray results in no injury, beyond irritation that can be addressed through decontamination.\par
b.  No later than 20 days after the end of each month, the department shall post on its website a report containing the following information for the prior month, in total and by indicating the rate per 100 inmates in the custody of the department during such prior month: \par
1. fight infractions written against inmates;\par
\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 2.  assaults on inmates by inmates involving stabbings, shootings or slashings;\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\li720\sl480\slmult1 3.  assaults on inmates by inmates in which an inmate suffered a serious injury, excluding assaults involving stabbings, shootings or slashings;\par
4. actual incidents of use of force A;\par
5. actual incidents of use of force B; \par
6.  actual incidents of use of force C;\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 7. assaults on staff by inmates in which staff suffered serious injury.\par
c. No later than 45 days after the end of each quarter ending March 31, June 30, September 30 and December 31, the department shall post on its website a report containing the following information for the prior quarter, in total and by indicating the rate per 100 inmates in the custody of the department during such prior quarter.  Such report shall also disaggregate the following information by listing adults, young adults, and adolescent inmates separately:\par
1. fight infractions written against inmates;\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\li720\sl480\slmult1 2. assaults on inmates by inmates in which an inmate suffered a serious injury, excluding assaults involving stabbings, shootings or slashings;\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 3.  assaults on inmates by inmates involving stabbings;\par
4.  assaults on inmates by inmates involving shootings;\par
5.  assaults on inmates by inmates involving slashings;\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\li720\sl480\slmult1 6. total number of assaults on inmates by inmates involving stabbings, shootings or slashings;\par
7.  total number of assaults on inmates by inmates involving stabbings, shootings or slashings in which an inmate suffered a serious injury; \line 8. assaults on inmates by inmates in which an inmate was admitted to a hospital as a result;\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1 9. homicides of inmates by inmates;\par
10. attempted suicides by inmates;\par
11. suicides by inmates;\par
12. assaults on staff by inmates;\par
13. assaults on staff by inmates in which staff suffered serious injury; \par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\li720\sl480\slmult1 14.  assaults on staff by inmates in which the staff was transported to a hospital as a result;     \par
15. incidents in which an inmate splashed staff;\par
16. allegations of use of force A;\par
17.  actual incidents of use of force A;\par
18. inmate hospitalization as a result of use of force A; \par
19. allegations of use of force B;\par
20. actual incidents of use of force B; \par
21. allegations of use of force C;\par
22. actual incidents of use of force C; \par
23. incidents of use of force C in which chemical agents were used.\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\li-86\sl480\slmult1\ulnone             \ul d. Beginning July 1, 2016 and every July first thereafter, the department shall post on its website a report for the prior calendar year containing information pertaining to (1) allegations of sexual abuse of an inmate by an inmate; (2) substantiated incidents of sexual abuse of an inmate by an inmate; (3) allegations of sexual abuse of an inmate by staff; and (4) substantiated incidents of sexual abuse of an inmate by staff.\par
\ulnone\tab\tab\ul e. The information in subdivisions b, c and d of this section shall be compared to previous reporting periods, and shall be permanently stored on the department\rquote s website.\ulnone\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\'a7 2. This local law takes effect July 1, 2016, except that the repeal of section 9-130 of the administrative code of the city of New York takes effect July 16, 2016.\par
